bug.author: amogkam
bug.summary: [core/win] test_multi_tenancy timed out on Windows CI
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>

<denchmark-code>==================== Test output for //python/ray/tests:test_multi_tenancy: ============================= test session starts ============================= platform win32 -- Python 3.7.9, pytest-5.4.3, py-1.10.0, pluggy-0.13.1 -- C:\hostedtoolcache\windows\Python\3.7.9\x64\python.exe cachedir: .pytest_cache rootdir: C:\Users\runneradmin\AppData\Local\Temp\Bazel.runfiles_elkr07jz\runfiles\com_github_ray_project_ray plugins: asyncio-0.14.0, rerunfailures-9.1.1, sugar-0.9.4, timeout-1.4.2 collecting ... collected 7 items
::test_initial_workers PASSED [ 14%] ::test_multi_drivers ================================================================================ ==================== Test output for //python/ray/tests:test_multi_tenancy: ============================= test session starts ============================= platform win32 -- Python 3.7.9, pytest-5.4.3, py-1.10.0, pluggy-0.13.1 -- C:\hostedtoolcache\windows\Python\3.7.9\x64\python.exe cachedir: .pytest_cache rootdir: C:\Users\runneradmin\AppData\Local\Temp\Bazel.runfiles_8tc83myt\runfiles\com_github_ray_project_ray plugins: asyncio-0.14.0, rerunfailures-9.1.1, sugar-0.9.4, timeout-1.4.2 collecting ... collected 7 items

::test_initial_workers PASSED [ 14%] ::test_multi_drivers ================================================================================ </denchmark-code>
Ray version and other system information (Python version, TensorFlow version, OS): <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Please provide a short code snippet (less than 50 lines if possible) that can be copy-pasted to reproduce the issue. The snippet should have no external library dependencies (i.e., use fake or mock data / environments): If the code snippet cannot be run by itself, the issue will be closed with "needs-repro-script".
I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue. I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.
